?UPDATE 6/2/22
  • Bracco Letter - May 18, 2022
  • Bracco Letter - May 4, 2022
  • ?Bracco Letter - March 2022
Description:
UPDATE 5/20: 
Bracco Diagnostics communicated that one of the major U.S. suppliers of iodinated contrast media is currently experiencing a supply shortage. To ensure a steady supply, Bracco has implemented a new ordering process. Please review the letter for more details.   
UPDATE 5/13: 
HealthTrust has been notified that there is a significant shortage of GE Omnipaque radiographic contrast media due to production limitations at GE?s Shanghai facility, resulting from the COVID lock-downs. While GE is not a contracted supplier in this category, we know that some members still utilize GE. GE customers are currently on product allocations. Bracco is the HealthTrust contracted supplier for Radiographic Contrast Media. Bracco has confirmed that they will continue to supply HealthTrust committed customers with their historical usage of radiographic contrast media. Bracco is evaluating how they may support other HealthTrust members affected by the GE supply disruption. To ensure no disruption or delay in on-going orders, please refrain from ordering in large excess of current utilization in an effort to stock up against the risk of no future supply. Doing so may delay timing of processing the order as Bracco validates against past usage. We recommend conservation measures for radiographic contrast media be implemented by all members regardless of the manufacturer utilized. Conservation may enable suppliers to move inventory as necessary to handle critical patient needs.
Issue_x0020_Type: Not Specified - Global Supply Challenges, Labor Shortages, Demand Fluctuations
Resources:
• ??Award Summary
  • Clinical Resource - ASHP Contrast Conservation Guidance
  • Clinical Resource - HealthTrust Contrast Conservation Guidance
  • Clinical Resource - PFS

Description:
There is a current shortage of the Fresenius Kabi manufactured ?BioFlex? blood bags. The America's Blood Centers and Blood Centers of America members project
that 10-15% of all whole blood collections are impacted by this shortage.  The blood bag shortage situation is a result of pandemic-related factors, primary of which is the impact
of Omicron on the Fresenius Kabi labor force, which kept capacity in December at 67%. Fresenius Kabi
has improved capacity since December to 83% by hiring more people (26 added to the line), increasing
incentives, and reducing turnover and absenteeism in their Puerto Rico manufacturing plant.
Issue_x0020_Type: Labor Shortages, Manufacturing Delays from Third Party Vendor
Resources:
• ?Award Summary
  • Clinical Resource - AABB Extending B?lood Supply Tips
  • Clinical Resource - Blood Conservation
Cross_x0020_Reference_x0020_Prod: ?No cross posted

Description: The blood bag shortage is a result of COVID-19-related staffing and labor force issues, specifically affecting the Fresenius Kabi manufactured ?BioFlex? blood bags. Unfortunately, the existing stock of blood bags was severely depleted since they were not able to keep up with demand.
